description:
The year is 2130 and the world has been decimated by a devastating third world war, making the planet a dangerous, apocalyptic hellhole. There is, however, one hope: Adam Blade, a fake priest with big fists and a nasty disposition. He's the closest thing this world's got to a superhero, but like any superhero, he has a weakness. In Adam's case, it isn't Kryptonite; it's cuties in sexy little outfits, usually of the schoolgirl variety.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

Website | Twitter | Facebook | Artist page (lantis) Introduction Granrodeo (stylized as GRANRODEO, and also known as KISHOW x e-Zuka) is a Japanese rock band, specializing in creating anime soundtracks. They are currently under the record label Lantis (2005-2009, 2012-), while previously having been under GloryHeaven (2009-2012) Biography In 2005 voice actor Kishō Taniyama ("Kishow") and musician Masaaki Iizuka ("E-Zuka"), known for his collaborations in creating anime soundtracks, decided to create a new project. During their years as a band, they released a few singles that were used as opening singles for the anime series. In 2007 they released their first album, Ride on the Edge, and in 2008 they release a second album, Instinct. In spring 2009 they started working on the soundtrack, the series Needless, for which E-Zuka wrote the soundtracks and Kishow wrote the lyrics for the song "Modern Strange Cowboy". By the end of 2009, they released their third album, Brush the Scar Lemon. In 2011 they released their fourth album, Supernova, and in 2012 they released their fifth album Crack Star Flash. Granrodeo covered "Tell Me" for the June 6, 2018 hide tribute album Tribute Impulse. Members Kishou Taniyama (谷山紀章/Kishow) - vocals, lyrics. (2005-) According to him, the role of a vocalist is more suitable for him than the role of a voice actor. Masaaki Iizuka (飯塚昌明/E-Zuka) - Guitar, composer, arranging. (2005-) His style of playing the guitar combines melodic solo parts and aggressive guitar riffs. He also collaborates with Minami Kuribayashi. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

A Japanese voice actress and singer. She used to be a child actress by the name of Eri Okamura. 

She is primarily known for her role in Blood+ as Saya Otonashi and singing "Tsuyogari," the third ending for the anime series Konjiki No Gash Bell!! She is also known to be an amateur manga artist in Japan in her spare time. Kitamura is affiliated with talent agency Early Wing and was formerly affiliated with Kaleidoscope.

Currently works in the music unit ARTERY VEIN with Asami Imai. Also provides the voice of CUL, a Vocaloid.

__Height:__ 158cm
__Nickname:__ Minorin (みのりん)

[Official Website](https://www.minorichihara.com/) | [Profile (HoriPro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/chihara) | [Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/chiharaminori/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/minori_parade/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minori_contact) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minori_chihara/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minori_Chihara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/茅原実里)

Minori Chihara is a Japanese voice actress and singer.

On April 2, 2021, she announced via her blog that she was taking an indefinite hiatus on her singing activities at the end of the year, but continuing to voice act.

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuiyui_makino) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yui-makino/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_makino0119/) | [Website](http://www.yuiyuimakino.com/)

A Japanese voice actor, singer, and pianist. She married the singer-songwriter [Yutaro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/182317/Yuutarou-Miura) on June 12, 2020. 
 
Makino took up piano at the age of four. Her talent was discovered by the film director Shunji Iwai when she was only seven years old, and from the age of 8 to 17, she played piano solos for three of his films, one of which was _Love Letter_. She then graduated from Tokyo College of Music as piano major in 2008 with the top score in her senior year piano ensemble.

Makino has appeared in two films, several commercials, and a TV Drama. She also sang the ending theme of a Wii game, Arc Rise Fantasia. The song, which she wrote the lyrics and music of herself, was titled "Tenshi no Hashigo ~crepuscular rays~".

She was nominated for "Best Young Seiyuu"  for her outstanding portrayal of Misaki Nakahara in Welcome To The N.H.K!.

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Zhezhi - Wuthering Waves (VG)

__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Enatsu Yuki (江夏由結)__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, songwriter and series composer. She was previously an animator, and she currently works for Studio Live, while also being a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
Kazuo Takigawa is an animator, character designer and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/numa_milky)

Numata is best known for his strongly distorted character style and peculiar sense for timing, often being named as an animator of the [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) school. He tends to work together with character designer [Kyuuta Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/106111/), whose disproportionated character designs particularly fit his style, employing often large teardrops, which brought him to spotlight in [Higurashi no Naku Koro ni](https://anilist.co/anime/934/). The duo also participated together in several other shows, such as [Ichigo Mashimaro](https://anilist.co/anime/488/) and [Strawberry Panic](https://anilist.co/anime/855/).

Every now and then works under one of his many pseudonyms.

(Source: Anidb)
